title: Welcome to r universe

reading what we have to say!

mtcars %>%
  filter(mpg > 22)

Distill is a publication format for scientific and technical writing, native to the web.

Today I am happy to successfully automate my blog updates with Github.

title: This is my fourth post...
contents:
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
library(janitor)
setwd("~/Downloads")
at_health_facilities <- read_csv("at_health_facilities.csv")

at_health_facilities <- clean_names(at_health_facilities)

# How many countries reported data? 100
length(unique(at_health_facilities$iso3))

[1] 100

# What is the difference between the minimum and maximum year with valid data for each country?

at_health_facilities %>%
  filter(is.numeric(age_15_17) | is.numeric(age_20_34)) %>%
  group_by(iso3) %>%
  summarize(dif = max(year) - min(year))

# A tibble: 100 × 2
   iso3    dif
   <chr> <dbl>
 1 AFG       0
 2 ALB       3
 3 ARG       0
 4 ARM      10
 5 AZE       0
 6 BDI       5
 7 BEN      10
 8 BFA       7
 9 BGD      10
10 BIH       5
# … with 90 more rows

title: ggplot2
description: A short description of the post.
contents:
Distill is a publication format for scientific and technical writing, native to the web.
Learn more about using Distill at https://rstudio.github.io/distill.


library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(mtcars, 
       aes(x=mpg, y = cyl)) +
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth()
